laboratory_examinations.findings: Nadir CD4+ T-lymphocyte count was 21 cells per cubic millimeter 3 years before presentation; last CD4+ count was 198 cells per cubic millimeter 15 months before presentation; current CD4+ count was 265 cells per cubic millimeter.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: CD4+ T-lymphocyte count increased from 198 cells per cubic millimeter to 265 cells per cubic millimeter.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Serum sodium 139 mmol per liter, potassium 3.5 mmol per liter, chloride 103 mmol per liter, bicarbonate 22 mmol per liter.
Blood urea nitrogen 15 mg per deciliter; serum creatinine 0.8 mg per deciliter.
Albumin level 4.2 g per deciliter, total serum protein 8.5 g per deciliter; other liver-function tests normal.
Lactate dehydrogenase level was 158 U per liter (normal range, 135 to 225).
Hematocrit 36.9%, platelet count 279,000 per cubic millimeter, white-cell count 6470 per cubic millimeter (59% neutrophils, 31% lymphocytes, 8% monocytes, 2% eosinophils).

CSF contained 409 red cells per cubic millimeter (tube 1) and 244 red cells per cubic millimeter (tube 4), 10 white cells per cubic millimeter (tube 1) and 9 white cells per cubic millimeter (tube 4); proteins 94 mg per deciliter; glucose 58 mg per deciliter; positive for Epsteinâ€“Barr virus on PCR assay.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreasing levels of erythrocytes in subsequent tubes suggest a traumatic tap.
